subject: Re: [junit] Using the swingui TestRunner
msgSnippet: Don t use global data, in general. Your variable url is global data within the context of MyTest. When you rely on global data, things may happen in an
messageBody:
Don't use global data, in general. Your variable 'url' is global data within the context of MyTest. When you rely on global data, things may happen in an unpredictable order.

Since you are calling TestRunner.run() directly, then don't limit yourself on how you construct your suite. Simply pass the URL to a method that creates the suite, so that that method can use the URL in the TestCase's setUp method.

One big thing: never call System.exit. There's almost never a good reason to do it.

>So said Jesse Marlin on 4/10/2003 --------------------
>
>I want to be able to either use textui or swingui to call my set of
>tests, so I have the following:
>
>public class MyTest extends TestCase
>{
> private static String url;
>
> private SoapClient client;
>
> public static void main (String[] args)
> {
> try
> {
> url = new String (args[0]);
> }
> catch (Exception x)
> {
> System.err.println (x);
> System.exit (-1);
> }
>
> //junit.textui.TestRunner.run (suite());
> junit.swingui.TestRunner.run (MyTest.class);
> }
>
> protected void setUp()
> {
> try
> {
> client = SoapClient.getInstance (url);
> }
> catch (Exception x)
> {
> System.err.println ("\nFailed to get instance of client
>to " + url);
> System.err.println (x);
> System.exit (-1);
> }
>
> client.setKeepAlive (true);
> }
>
> public static Test suite()
> {
> return new TestSuite (DcsDashboardSoapMethodsTest.class);
> }
>
> public void testNumberOne()
> {
> // Client here is null when called from swingui but
> // works when called from textui.
>
> assertTrue (true);
> }
>};
>
>When running in textui mode the url gets set fine. But while running
>in swingui mode url is null. I have also tried passing a property
>through the -Durl="something" and in setup reading that property to
>no avail. Hard coding the url is the only thing that works. I have
>left some code out here, but the general layout is the same. The test
>above always succeeds, but in my case I am accessing client which is
>null because url is null. Does anybody have suggestions as to what I
>can do?
>
>This is my first use of JUnit, and I am fairly new to Java as well.
>Thanks for any help.
